data.question: What is the purpose of incorporating a pyrrolidine moiety and a polyoxometalate in the synthesis process?
data.answer: To achieve a tandem catalyst for the efficient conversion of CO2 into value-added enantiomerically pure cyclic carbonates.

data.question: What role do the multi-catalytic sites play in the framework?
data.answer: The multi-catalytic sites are orderly distributed and spatially matched in the framework to drive the tandem catalytic process in an asymmetric fashion.

data.question: True or False: The structural simplicity and the use of inexpensive and readily available chemical reagents make the approach highly promising for CO2 conversion.
What is the yield percentage of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1 after three rounds of the tandem reaction?
What is the enantiomer excess (ee) percentage for (R)-styrene oxide catalyzed by ZnW (cid:2) PYI1?
True or False: The CO2 adsorption capacity of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1 is higher than most other MOFs reported.
What is the effect of temperature on the enantioselectivity of the coupling reaction of CO2 to styrene oxide?
data.answer: Decreasing the reaction temperature from 80 °C to 30 °C led to dramatic increases in enantioselectivity.

data.question: True or False: ZnW (cid:2) PYI1 can be reused at least three times with moderate loss of activity and slight decrease in selectivity.
What is the role of NH2 groups in the channels of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1?
data.answer: NH2 groups in the channels act as accessible sites to activate CO2 directly, enabling the catalytic performance in the coupling of carbon dioxide with epoxide.

data.question: True or False: The presence of a C ¼ O stretching vibration at 1,675 cm (cid:2) 1 in the infrared spectra of the catalyst impregnated with a CH2Cl2 solution of cinnamaldehyde suggests the absorbance and activation of cinnamaldehyde in the cavities of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1.
What is the significance of the circular dichroism spectrum of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1?
data.answer: It shows that the chiral L (cid:2) PYI introduced into the POMOF facilitates transfer of chirality from L (cid:2) PYI to the POM, indicating distinct induced optical activity.

data.question: True or False: The transformation of asymmetric epoxidation was initially examined using styrene and t-butylhydroperoxide (TBHP) as the oxidant, along with ZnW (cid:2) PYI1 in a heterogeneous reaction.
What is the role of the Keggin anion ZnW12O40 6 (cid:2) in the crystal structure of POMOFs?
data.answer: The Keggin anion connects to four zinc ions through the terminal oxygen atoms and acts as a four connector, forming a two-dimensional square grid sheet.

data.question: True or False: The use of L (cid:2) PYI and Zn3[ZnW12O40] as homogeneous catalysts gave a conversion of 55% and an ee value of 18%.
What is the calculated yield percentage for the synthesis of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1?

True or False: The intrinsic crystalline properties of POM-based homochiral MOFs offer the potential to facilitate analysis of the intermediates and the catalytic processes of each step of the tandem asymmetric transformation.
What is the role of the NH2-BPY ligands in the framework?
data.answer: NH2-BPY ligands coordinate to two different zinc ions and further bridge the sheets to form a three-dimensional framework with one-dimensional chiral channels along the b axis.

data.question: True or False: The transformation of the asymmetric coupling of CO2 to styrene oxide exhibited excellent reaction efficiency for phenyl(ethylene carbonate).
What is the significance of the removability of the coordinated water molecules in ZnW (cid:2) PYI1?
data.answer: It indicates the potential of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1 to act as an active Lewis acid catalyst.

data.question: True or False: The presence of a C ¼ O stretching vibration in the infrared spectra of the catalyst impregnated with a CH2Cl2 solution of cinnamaldehyde suggests the inactivation of cinnamaldehyde in the cavities of ZnW (cid:2) PYI1.
